qas.question: What was the original name of Marvel Comics?
In what city was Marvel based when it was founded?
What was Abraham Goodman's official title when Marvel was founded?
What was Timely Publications originally called?
Who created the western pulp genre?
When did Timely Publications become Marvel Comics?
Who decided to rename Timely Publications to Marvel Comics?

context: <a0_0>Martin Goodman<a0_0/> founded the company later known as <b6_0>Marvel Comics<b6_0/> under the name <a1_0>Timely Publications<a1_0/> in <a2_0><b8_0>1939<b8_0/><a2_0/>. <b7_0>Martin Goodman<b7_0/>, a pulp magazine publisher who had started with a Western pulp in <b5_0>1933<b5_0/>, was expanding into the emerging—and by then already highly popular—new medium of comic books. Launching his new line from his existing company's offices at 330 West 42nd Street, <a3_0>New York City<a3_0/>, he officially held the titles of editor, managing editor, and business manager, with <b9_0>Abraham Goodman<b9_0/> officially listed as <a4_0>publisher<a4_0/>.
